match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 64 balls remaining)

image.caption: A general view of the redeveloped R Premadasa Stadium
image.longCaption: A general view of the redeveloped R Premadasa Stadium, Basnahira v Wayamba, SLC Inter-provisional limited-over tournament, Colombo, 23 January 2011

match.hoursInfo: 10.00 start, First Session 10.00-13.30 Interval 13.30-14.15, Second Session 14.15-17.45

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara c Mathews b BAW Mendis 51 (69b 1x4 0x6 93m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: picks out midwicket! He went deep in his crease, then down on his knee to sweep. Connected strongly but picked out Mathews on the edge of the ring

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root lbw b Mathews 42 (57b 1x4 0x6 71m) SR: 73.68

dismissalComment.html: full length at the stumps, Root seems to play all around it, huge appeal for lbw and instantly given out. It seemed to be just a straight delivery angled into the stumps, Root was aiming too leg side and when he missed, he was in big trouble, Steve Davis greedily getting his finger up almost before Mathews had the chance to turn around

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: just as the stand was building, and Bopara needed support, Woakes charges down the pitch and is beaten leaving Sangakkara which a simple stumping. Hang on, the umpire wants to check the no-ball. It's very tight, is anything grounded behind the line? This would be very careless from Mendis. The foot drags forward a touch, and it's ruled to legal. Just.
picks out midwicket! He went deep in his crease, then down on his knee to sweep. Connected strongly but picked out Mathews on the edge of the ring
and another! Wasn't much more than a straight delivery and it took an inside edge into the stumps as Finn prodded forward without any conviction
big early strike! The in-form opener departs. Coming down the pitch, aiming over the leg side, loses his shape on the shot. The ball hits his back pad then cannons into leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! England falling apart to spin, again. The captain's problems continue. Swept a full delivery, it takes the top edge and couldn't have picked out deep square-leg with any more precision

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali b Dilshan 2 (7b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: big early strike! The in-form opener departs. Coming down the pitch, aiming over the leg side, loses his shape on the shot. The ball hits his back pad then cannons into leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c NLTC Perera b Herath 11 (12b 0x4 0x6 22m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: picks out long-off! Coming down the pitch, trying to repeat his shot of the previous over, lofts it very straight but without the distance. Thisara Perera judges the catch well, had plenty of time to see it. Nicely bowled by Herath who held the delivery back, Bell wasn't quite to the pitch

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c MDKJ Perera b Dilshan 22 (37b 3x4 0x6 36m) SR: 59.45

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! England falling apart to spin, again. The captain's problems continue. Swept a full delivery, it takes the top edge and couldn't have picked out deep square-leg with any more precision

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Thirimanne b NLTC Perera 17 (29b 1x4 0x6 37m) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: length ball sliding across Morgan who feels hard for it and pops a catch to short extra cover who gets down well to his right hand side. The slow nature of this pitch evident here, the ball not coming on at all for Morgan leaning outside off to press into the covers, he's there too soon and taps a relatively straightforward chance to the fielder who took a smart catch

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root lbw b Mathews 42 (57b 1x4 0x6 71m) SR: 73.68

dismissalComment.html: full length at the stumps, Root seems to play all around it, huge appeal for lbw and instantly given out. It seemed to be just a straight delivery angled into the stumps, Root was aiming too leg side and when he missed, he was in big trouble, Steve Davis greedily getting his finger up almost before Mathews had the chance to turn around

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler b Prasad 7 (14b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: well, Buttler won't be targetting Prasad. He's fallen to him for the second time in two innings. And in very similar manner, getting an inside edge on a length delivery which cannons into the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Woakes st †Sangakkara b BAW Mendis 15 (20b 2x4 0x6 35m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: just as the stand was building, and Bopara needed support, Woakes charges down the pitch and is beaten leaving Sangakkara which a simple stumping. Hang on, the umpire wants to check the no-ball. It's very tight, is anything grounded behind the line? This would be very careless from Mendis. The foot drags forward a touch, and it's ruled to legal. Just.

headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Steven Finn b BAW Mendis 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and another! Wasn't much more than a straight delivery and it took an inside edge into the stumps as Finn prodded forward without any conviction

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harry Gurney b Prasad 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: and that is that! Aiming to carve through the off side he gets a bottom edge into his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene not out 77 (80b 8x4 1x6 111m) SR: 96.25
Kumar Sangakkara not out 67 (93b 8x4 0x6 127m) SR: 72.04

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket and going big over the leg side, Dilshan gets it all wrong, a leading edge goes straight up in the air, three fielders converge around short mid-on and Woakes takes the catch and England bag an important wicket. Total miscue from Dilshan aiming over the leg side, it went a long way up but Woakes took control of the situation

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: back of a length at the body, pulled into the leg side and finds square leg! Easy catch for Bopara, just popped up by Perera cramped for room and getting the pull all wrong. Change of angle works immediately for Finn; the first ball angled in at Perera and it's done the trick

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Bopara b Finn 9 (10b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: back of a length at the body, pulled into the leg side and finds square leg! Easy catch for Bopara, just popped up by Perera cramped for room and getting the pull all wrong. Change of angle works immediately for Finn; the first ball angled in at Perera and it's done the trick

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Woakes b Ali 26 (23b 5x4 0x6 35m) SR: 113.04

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket and going big over the leg side, Dilshan gets it all wrong, a leading edge goes straight up in the air, three fielders converge around short mid-on and Woakes takes the catch and England bag an important wicket. Total miscue from Dilshan aiming over the leg side, it went a long way up but Woakes took control of the situation

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: that'll do it, stand and delivery swing to a length ball, smashed straight over the bowler's head

commentPostTextItems.html: That's it from Colombo where England have much to think about. We travel to Hambantota for the third ODI on Wednesday, back as a day-night match so a 9am GMT start, 2.30pm local time, join us then...

Here's the losing captain, what's his name? Oh it's Alastair Cook..."We thought it was a good toss to win but I'm not sure that was the right choice. Sri Lanka totally outplayed us in all departments today. We assessed the pitch wrong but it's how you play and Sri Lanka put us under pressure with the ball. Then you end up having to try stuff in the field and keep players up and that gives class players the chance to hit boundaries. We had a few big shots that just evaded fielders but they played so well. It's been a tough few days, we've had no practise time with the rain, it'll be good to get out of Colombo and have a fresh start. We've got some good players and we can bounce back."

Angelo Mathews: "It feels great. The bowlers did the job, Dilshan was brilliant and then Mahela and Sanga showed how to bat on that wicket. It was playing a bit slow so I opened with Dilshan, especially as Moeen likes faster bowlers. I keep changing the bowlers because they're all good and they were brilliant today. Our fielding has picked up a little bit but we still can improve." Man of the Match goes to Mahela Jayawardene.

Dear Alastair, if you care about England's chances this winter, pls resign and just concentrate on Test cricket...#getHalesin

— Kevin Pietersen (@KP24) November 29, 2014
<script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>
Suyog: "Dilshan should get Man of the match here...wickets of Cook and Ali and crucial hits at the start of the innings."
Presentation coming up shortly. Man of the match choice? Ajantha Mendis for his three wickets? Or the crowd choice no doubt, Jayawardene for his graceful innings in the chase?

England had a batting performance to be fairly pleased with in the opening rubber but there's nothing to take away from today - save perhaps more runs for Ravi Bopara. It's been a miserable day. They got nothing going with the bat, struggling badly once again to spin, and were fired out for a very poor total which their bowlers were unable to make any impression with in the second half of the game.

About as comprehensive a victory as you're likely to see that, Sri Lanka have won by eight wickets, strolling to victory in a cakewalk of a run chase that looked straightforward at tea but Mahela Jayawardene in particular, along with his old mucker Kumar Sangakkara, have given England the run around in the field, teasing them for a while with careful accumulation and then hurrying to the target after drinks. Easy peasy.

commentPreTextItems.html: So this should be the final over, finish it off Sanga...

commentTextItems.html: full just outside off pushing to cover
booooo...gentle nudge out to deep midwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Told you he's brought out the give-it-a-tonk-I'm-hungry bat...

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: down the track again, going leg side this time, a pleasant flick over mid-on and Sri Lanka are a hit away now
carefully pushed into the covers
aha, some timing from Sangakkara, down the wicket, staying leg side of the ball and driving over cover, the timing so good the sweeper has no chance
down the wicket to drive firmly to short extra cover
forward just outside off to press to cover
pressing forward to a length ball around off stump, a little nudge/outside edge brings a couple fine of third man

commentPostTextItems.html: Big over and now the winning line within smacking distance...

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a step down the wicket and now hoists this down the ground, gets plenty of it and that's the first six of the same over the long-on rope, had to fetch it slightly but the timing was excellent nevertheless
this drifts too far into the body and Jayawardene gets inside the line to play a gentle flick fine of long leg
a step down the wicket and a whack to the leg side, short of deep midwicket, another rather ugly shot from Sangakkara, not at his best today but grinding out the runs
full on the leg stump, flicked wide enough of long leg to allow the second

commentPreTextItems.html: Just another 29 needed now and Harry Gurney is onto bowl...

commentTextItems.html: around the wicket, length angling in and Jayawardene tickles it to deep square
forward just outside off, prodded up the wicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Akseli: "76 50s for Jayawardene and 88 for Sangakkara. Almost unfair and unreal." They both have outrageous numbers...

commentTextItems.html: this time gets into a proper position to cut and finds deep point
hangs back and tries to cut but it was too full and he missed and almost fell over backwards
down the track and a gorgeous lofted drive over mid-off, such simple sweep strokemaking
another one, this into the hands of Buttler who dropped it, not sure if there was anything on that
just outside off, a reverse sweep somehow slips between the keeper and first slip and dances away for four, another sign of England's predicament today

dismissalComment.html: and another! Wasn't much more than a straight delivery and it took an inside edge into the stumps as Finn prodded forward without any conviction

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harry Gurney b Prasad 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: and that is that! Aiming to carve through the off side he gets a bottom edge into his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Woakes b Ali 26 (23b 5x4 0x6 35m) SR: 113.04

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket and going big over the leg side, Dilshan gets it all wrong, a leading edge goes straight up in the air, three fielders converge around short mid-on and Woakes takes the catch and England bag an important wicket. Total miscue from Dilshan aiming over the leg side, it went a long way up but Woakes took control of the situation

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Bopara b Finn 9 (10b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: back of a length at the body, pulled into the leg side and finds square leg! Easy catch for Bopara, just popped up by Perera cramped for room and getting the pull all wrong. Change of angle works immediately for Finn; the first ball angled in at Perera and it's done the trick

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara not out 67 (93b 8x4 0x6 127m) SR: 72.04
Mahela Jayawardene not out 77 (80b 8x4 1x6 111m) SR: 96.25

milestones.description: Ian Bell has scored 34 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ENG breaking Pietersen's record

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15

stories.title: Dilshan - Firebrand among saner men
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Fernando: Dilshan - Firebrand among saner men
stories.summary: He will never be regarded as a statesmen of the game. Tillakaratne Dilshan is an individualist, never shy of stealing the moment

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan raced out of the blocks
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan raced out of the blocks, Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo, November 29, 2014

stories.title: Cook rebukes Pietersen dig, again
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.summary: For the second time this year, Kevin Pietersen suggested Alastair Cook should quit the England captaincy. This time he tweeted his dissatisfaction with England's one-day form, though Cook is just as disinclined to listen

image.caption: It was another difficult day for England in the field
image.longCaption: It was another difficult day for England in the field, Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo, November 29, 2014

stories.title: England's World Cup plans in a spin
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: England's World Cup plans in a spin
stories.summary: Given the traumatic events of this week a one-day defeat is really not important at all so this match has to be analysed in a different light but will have to admit how poorly they performed

image.caption: Moeen Ali looks back to see his stumps disturbed
image.longCaption: Moeen Ali looks back to see his stumps disturbed, Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo, November 29, 2014

image.longCaption: Dhammika Prasad collected two wickets, Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo, November 29, 2014

stories.title: Sri Lanka canter to 2-0 series lead
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka canter to 2-0 series lead
stories.summary: England presented Sri Lanka with the sort of run chase that Kumar Sangakkara and Mahela Jayawardene could have supervised in their sleep.

image.caption: Mahela Jayawardene picked England off with ease
image.longCaption: Mahela Jayawardene picked England off with ease, Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo, November 29, 2014

stories.title: 'Not been easy to concentrate' - Mathews
stories.subTitle: Phillip Hughes 1988-2014
stories.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews admitted that it has been difficult to focus on the cricket following the death of Phillip Hughes

image.caption: A man plays tribute to Phillip Hughes at the Adelaide Oval
image.longCaption: A man plays tribute to Phillip Hughes at the Adelaide Oval, November 28, 2014

stories.title: Teams to play ODI as tribute to Hughes
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Teams to play ODI as tribute to Phillip Hughes
stories.summary: Alastair Cook, England's captain, said that the players from both sides wanted the game to go ahead as a tribute to Phillip Hughes

image.caption: Alastair Cook picked up a steady fifty
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook picked up a steady fifty, Sri Lanka A v England XI, Tour match, SSC, Colombo, November 21, 2014

stories.title: England search for cohesion
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo

image.caption: The England team pays tribute to Phillip Hughes
image.longCaption: The England team pays tribute to Phillip Hughes, Colombo, November 28, 2014

videos.title: You feel the heat when not scoring runs - Cook
videos.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: You feel the heat when not scoring runs - Cook
videos.summary: England captain Alastair Cook admitted his team did not adjust to conditions fast enough as they were comfortably defeated by Sri Lanka adding that the pressure was mounting on him to score some runs at the top of the order

videos.title: We pushed them back from the start - Mathews
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: We pushed them back from the start - Mathews
videos.summary: Angelo Mathews praised his bowlers as Sri Lanka comfortably defeated England in the second ODI, adding that the team must remain focused and not take the visitors for granted

videos.title: Sri Lanka better in every department
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 2nd ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Sri Lanka better in every department
videos.summary: Andrew Fernando reports from the second ODI between England and Sri Lanka where the home side cruised to an eight-wicket win in an almost faultless display

videos.title: Match to go ahead in Hughes' honour
videos.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Match to go ahead in Hughes' honour
videos.summary: Andrew Fernando and Alan Gardner look ahead to the 2nd ODI between Sri Lanka and England which will go ahead after discussions between the two teams following the death of Phillip Hughes
